moves.1. e4: Here is a game where despite one losing a lot matter. Do not panic. there is still chance of winning or draw.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: Wanting my light Bishop attack the f7 pawn.
moves.3... Nh6:
Up till now been a book opening But black would be better:
3. … Nf6 4. d3
moves.4. Ng5: Want my Knight to join attack on the f7 pawn.
moves.4... Qxg5: Black attacking my d2 pawn square by taking my Knight on g5
moves.5. Qf3:
Continuing my attack on the f7 pawn.
Better: 5. O-O Qh4 6. d3 Bc5 7. Bxh6 Qxh6 8. Nc3 O-O 9. Nd5 Bd6 10. c3 Kh8 11. Re1 f5 12. Qf3 fxe4 13. Qxe4
moves.5... Nd4: Black brings Knight into battle by attacking my Queen.
moves.6. Qe3: Ok, Decide I willing to exchange queen. I like a simplified game anyway
moves.6... Qxg2: Black did not want to exchange Queens at this time. He wants my Rook.
moves.7. Rf1: I am down a Pawn and a Piece at this time. I move my Rook so if taken, I take his Queen.
moves.7... Nf3+:
Puts my King in Check. I haft to move my King. Already can not castle King side.
Would be better: 8. … Nxc2+ 8. Kd1 Nxe3+ 9. fxe3 Qxe4 10. Bb5 Qg2 11. h4 Nf5 12. Nc3 Bb4 13. Bd3 d6 14. Be2 Bd7 15. h5 c6 16. d3
moves.8. Ke2: Move King so I can still support the Rook.
moves.8... Ng1+:
Checks again my King with same Knight.
Better: 9. … Nxc2+ 8. Kd1 Nxe3+ 9. fxe3 Qxe4 10. Bb5 Qg2 11. h4 Nf5 12. Nc3 Bb4 13. Bd3 d6 14. Be2 Bd7 15. h5 c6 16. d3
moves.9... b6:
black prepares to bring out his light Bishop on Queen side.
Better, 9. … Nf3+ 10. Kd1 Ng4 11. Qd3 Nxf2+ 12. Rxf2 Qxf2
moves.10. Bd5:
so I put my light Bishop on center attacking his Queen side Rook preventing him bring out Bishop and at the same time cover my e4 pawn. In case he wants to take it with the Queen.
Better: 10. Qg3 Qxe4+ 11. Kd1 Qxc4 12. Qxe5+ Qe6
moves.10... c6:
So He attacks my Bishop with the c pawn.
Better:10. … Nf3+ 11. Qxf3 Qxf3 12. Bxa8 Ng4
moves.11. Bc4: So move Bishop but still attacking f7 square.
moves.11... d5:
Attacks my Bishop and Pawn on e4 with his d pawn.
Better: … Nf3+ 11. Qxf3 Qxf3 12. Bxa8 Ng4
moves.12. exd5:
So let exchange pawns. 
Better: 12. Be2 Bg4 13. f3 Bc5 14. d4 Bxd4
moves.12... Ng4: Attacks my Queen with other Knight.
moves.13. Qg3: Again offer to offer to exchange Queens.
moves.13... Qe4+: He declines the offer and checks my King again.
moves.14... Ne2:
Moves g1 Knight to attack my bad Bishop and my Queen. Maybe even get to promote it.
Better: … Nxf2+ 15. Rxf2 Bg4+ 16. Qxg4 Qxg4+
moves.15. Bxe2: So I take it with Bishop with a possible exchange.
moves.16. dxc6:
This pawn is isalated so took Pawn because I can not protect and I can take a Pawn with it.
Better: 16. Bd3 Nxf2+ 17. Qxf2 Bg4+ 18. Be2 Bxe2+
moves.16... Qxc2+: Use His Queen to take my c Pawn. This where I thought I might of lost the game.
moves.17... Qxc1+: And I starts taking my pieces with his Queen
moves.18. Bd1: Move Bishop to protect the King.
moves.19. c7:
Threaten to promte my c Pawn.
Better: 19. Bxg4 Bxb1 20. Qc3 Qxc3 21. dxc3 Be4 22. Bd7+ Kd8
moves.19... Qxa1:
Fest on my Queen Rook. Burp!
Better? … Bb4 20. Nc3 Qxa1 21. Qf3 Bxc3 22. Qxa8+ Kd7 23. Qxh8 Kxc7
moves.20. Ba4+:
Finally re gang temp be checking King with my Bishop.
Better: … Bb4 20. Nc3 Qxa1 21. Qf3 Bxc3 22. Qxa8+ Kd7 23. Qxh8 Kxc7
moves.20... Bd7:
Blocks check with his good Bishop.
Better: 20. … Ke7 21. Ke2 Qd4 22. Nc3 Rc8 23. h3 Nf6
moves.21. Bxd7+: I take the Bishop so I can take his Knight with my Queen. then I can promote c Pawn.
moves.21... Kxd7: He takes the my Bishop. I am losing a lot of chessman. Getting very consider.
moves.22. Qxg4+: Take his Knight and keep tempo going.
moves.22... Kd6:
Surprised that c pawn was not taken.
Better: … Kxc7 23. Qc4+ Bc5 24. Qxf7+ Kb8
moves.23. c8=N+:
Promote c Pawn to Knight to continue to keep tempo. Want to keep pressure on the King. A Queen would not help because it would been taken by his Rook anyway but I would be able to still check the his King.
Better: 23. Ke2 Kxc7 24. Qe4 Qxa2 25. Qxa8 Qc4+
moves.23... Kc5:
Moves his King. Wonder why he did not take Knight?
Better: 23. … Kc7 24. Qc4+ Bc5 25. Ne7 Qxb1+
moves.24. Ke2:
Move my King to get King Rook into the battle.
Better: 24. Qe4 Rxc8 25. Ke2 Qxa2 26. Rc1+ Kd6 27. Rxc8 Qa6+ 28. Rc4 Ke6
moves.24... Qxa2:
Takes my a Pawn. 
Better: … Qd4 25. Rc1+ Kb5 26. Qf3 e4 27. Nc3+ Ka6
moves.25. Nc3:
Move my b Knight so he can not take it and attack the Queen at the same time.
Better: 25. Rc1+ Kb5 26. Nc3+ Ka5 27. Nxa2 f5 28. Qf3 Rxc8
moves.25... Qa6+: moves Queen and checks my King
moves.26... Rxc8:
He finally takes my c8 Knight with his good Rook.
Better: 26. … Qxc8 27. Qe4 Kd6 28. f4 Qxc3
moves.27. Na4+:
Check his King with Knight.
Better: 27. Ra1 h5 28. Qd7 Qxa1 29. Qxc8+ Kb4
moves.27... Kd5:
Move out of check.
Better: … Kd6 28. Qb4+ Kd7 29. Qb3 Ke8 30. Nc3 Qa5
moves.28. Qe4+:
Check his with my Queen. Trying to keep the his other Rook and Bishop bad.
Better: 28. Qd7+ Bd6 29. Rb1 Rc2+ 30. Ke3 Rhc8
moves.29. f4: move up f Pawn for support.
moves.29... Rc2+: Checks my king with good Rook.
moves.30. Ke3 Ra2:
Attacks my Knight.
Better: 30. … Qa5 31. Qxe5+ Qxe5+ 32. fxe5 b5 33. Ra1 a5
moves.31... Kd7 32. Qd5+: Keeping the tempo and pressure on him.
moves.32... Kc7: Better: 32. … Bd6 33. Qxf7+ Kd8 34. Qxa2 Re8+ 35. Kd2 Bb4+
moves.33. Rc1+: Here I knew I had him on the ropes.
moves.33... Kb8: Better: 33. … Bc5+ 34. Nxc5 bxc5 35. Qxc5+ Kb8 36. Rb1+ Qb6 37. Rxb6+ axb6 38. Qxb6+ Ka8 39. Qc6+ Ka7 40. Qc5+ Kb8 41. Qe5+ Ka7 42. Qxg7 Re8+ 43. Kf3 Rae2
moves.34... Kb7 35. Rc7#: Mate despite of lost of chessmen. Remember, Do not panic!
